alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:21PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rockingham, central Hillsborough and southeastern Merrimack Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Boston, or 9 miles northwest of Merrimack, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Merrimack, Bedford, Milford, Hooksett, Amherst, New Boston, Epsom, Mont Vernon, Lyndeborough, Francestown, Goffstown, Mount Vernon, Raymond, Weare, Londonderry, Bow, Chester, Allenstown and Deerfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 293 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 93 between mile markers 17 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern and central New Hampshire.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough
